content: To prove $f$ is continous, by definition we need to show that for all elements $x$ of $X$ and neighborhooods $V$ of $f(x)$, there exists a neighborhood $U$ of $x$ such that $f[U] \subseteq V$.

collapse.content: which can be seen by using your brain

content: One can see it suffices to prove that for all closed neighborhoods $V'$ of $f(x)$, there exists a neighborhood $U$ of $x$ such that $f[U] \subseteq V'$.
